# Introduction

In this session, we query the database and tailor it to a particular SAM structure for Nigeria.

## Libraries

```{r}
#| warning: false
#| message: false
#| label: libraries

# Clean workspace
rm(list = ls())

# Load libraries
library(tidyverse)
library(readxl)
library(openxlsx)
```


## Datasets

```{r}
#| warning: false
#| message: false
#| label: datasets

# Emissions long data
total_emissions <- readRDS("gears_db/data/outputs/gwp_total_emissions_long.rds")

# SAM Equivalence table
sam_equivalence <- read_xlsx(
  "gears_db/data/sam/nga/SAM-Nigeria-2021-Equivalence.xlsx",
  sheet = "sam-equivalence")

# SAM elements
sam_names <- read_xlsx(
  "gears_db/data/sam/nga/SAM-Nigeria-2021.xlsx",
  range = "B9:B224",
  sheet = "SAM-names",
  col_names = F)

colnames(sam_names) <- "SAM Name"

# Add Undetermined to SAM elements
undetermined_list <- sam_equivalence[startsWith(sam_equivalence$`ISIC Detail`, "9999"), 1]
colnames(undetermined_list) <- "SAM Name"
sam_names <- rbind(sam_names, undetermined_list)
```

## Matching to SAM Structure

We ask for an equivalence structure `sam_equivalence` in this case, between the `ISIC Detail` and the SAM. Through the use of R factors, we can make sure that the joined structure of the SAM is in the final product.

```{r}
nigeria_sam_emissions_2021 <- total_emissions |> 
  filter(
    ISO3 == "NGA",
    Year == 2021,
    #Unit == "kt"
  ) |> 
  left_join(
    sam_equivalence,
    join_by(`ISIC Detail`)
  ) |> 
  mutate(
    `SAM Name` = if_else(
      is.na(`SAM Name`), 
      `ISIC Detail`,
      `SAM Name`
    )
  ) |>
  mutate(
    `SAM Name` = factor(
      `SAM Name`,
      levels = sam_names$`SAM Name`
    )
  ) |> 
  pivot_wider(
    id_cols = c(
      Area,
      ISO3,
      Year,
      `IPCC Code`,
      IPCC,
      Element,
      Unit
    ),
    names_from = c(`SAM Name`),
    values_from = Value,
    values_fn = sum,
    names_expand = T
  ) |> 
  arrange(Unit) |> 
  mutate(
    Total = rowSums(across(where(is.numeric) & -3), na.rm = TRUE)
  )

# and save to file

write.xlsx(
  nigeria_sam_emissions_2021,
  file = "gears_db/data/outputs/emissions_nigeria_2021.xlsx")
```


### End

```{r}
pivot <- readRDS("gears_db/data/outputs/gwp_total_emissions_pivot.rds") |> 
  filter(Area=="Nigeria",
         Year==2021)
long <- readRDS("gears_db/data/outputs/gwp_total_emissions_long.rds") |> 
  filter(Area=="Nigeria",
         Year==2021)
write.xlsx(
  pivot,
  file = "gears_db/data/outputs/nigeria_emissions_2021_pivot.xlsx")
write.xlsx(
  long,
  file = "gears_db/data/outputs/nigeria_emissions_2021_long.xlsx")
```
